dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 1528 PCS: Veterinary Medicine Mobility Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and placed on the calendar

form.official-title: To amend the Controlled Substances Act to allow a veterinarian to transport and dispense controlled substances in the usual course of veterinary practice outside of the registered location.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Veterinary Medicine Mobility Act of 2014
.

section.header: Transport and dispensing of controlled substances in the usual course of veterinary practice

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

Notwithstanding paragraph (1), a registrant who is a veterinarian shall not be required to have a separate registration in order to transport and dispense controlled substances in the usual course of veterinary practice at a site other than the registrant’s registered principal place of business or professional practice, so long as the site of transporting and dispensing is located in a State where the veterinarian is licensed to practice veterinary medicine and is not a principal place of business or professional practice.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives July 8, 2014.

endorsement.action-desc: Received; read twice and placed on the calendar
